alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 10:54AM MST until July 31 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 200 PM MST. * At 1052 AM MST, Heavy rain that fell on Saturday have caused a rise at the gauge near Tuba City on the Moenkopi Wash, which has exceeded flood stage. Flooding was being reported in the area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tuba City, Moenkopi and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 313...and between mile markers 315 and 325. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 471 and 480. State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 325. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Hamblin Wash, Moenkopi Wash, Little Colorado River and Fivemile Wash. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
